page.title: 03SOCIAL LIFE AND RECREATION
page.content: Social life and recreation in the area consists largely of private entertaining, watching television, reading, playing records and forgathering in public houses. The Kingsland Amateur Theatrical Society was revived in 1982, having existed previously from the 1890s to 1920. The Society gives two performances a year with local musicians, the Christmas performance generally being a pantomime. The Vale of Arrow Choir meets once a week for practices in the school and gives concerts locally. "The Hereford Times" and "Admag" are published weekly, the latter being a free paper with largely advertisements. There is a local independent radio station, "Radio Wyvern", which informs the public about local events and news.
